intro: Phacelia brachyloba, commonly known as the short-stemmed phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in early spring. Phacelia brachyloba is also valued for its role in supporting pollinators and its use in ecological restoration projects.
